_**The Originals**_ is an American television series that began airing on [The
CW](/wiki/The_CW "The CW") on October 3, 2013. Created as a [spin-
off](/wiki/Spin-off_\(media\) "Spin-off \(media\)") of _[The Vampire
Diaries](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries "The Vampire Diaries"),_ the series follows
vampire-werewolf hybrid [Klaus Mikaelson](/wiki/Klaus_Mikaelson "Klaus
Mikaelson") as he and [his
family](/wiki/Original_Vampires_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "Original Vampires
\(The Vampire Diaries\)") become embroiled in the supernatural politics of New
Orleans.[1]

On May 10, 2017, The CW renewed the series for a fifth season.[2] On July 20,
2017, it was announced by series creator [Julie Plec](/wiki/Julie_Plec "Julie
Plec") ahead of [Comic Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego Comic-Con")
that the series' fifth season would be its last. The final season debuted on
April 18, 2018.[3][4][5]

## Series
overview[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Series overview")]

_The Originals,_ a [spin-off](/wiki/Spin-off_\(media\) "Spin-off \(media\)")
from _[The Vampire Diaries](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries "The Vampire Diaries"),_
centers around three of the [Mikaelson
siblings](/wiki/Original_Vampires_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "Original Vampires
\(The Vampire Diaries\)"): Klaus ([Joseph
Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan \(actor\)")), Elijah
([Daniel Gillies](/wiki/Daniel_Gillies "Daniel Gillies")), and Rebekah
([Claire Holt](/wiki/Claire_Holt "Claire Holt")). The Mikaelson family is
called "the Originals" as they are the first vampires to ever exist. Niklaus
"Klaus" Mikaelson is a descendant of a [witch](/wiki/Witch "Witch") and a
[werewolf](/wiki/Werewolf "Werewolf"), and his quest to unleash his
[hybrid](/wiki/Hybrid_\(biology\) "Hybrid \(biology\)") nature was detailed in
_[The Vampire Diaries](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries "The Vampire Diaries")_. The
[backdoor pilot](/wiki/Backdoor_pilot "Backdoor pilot"), which aired on April
25, 2013, also revealed that the werewolf Hayley ([Phoebe
Tonkin](/wiki/Phoebe_Tonkin "Phoebe Tonkin")) is pregnant with Klaus's child.
The series begins with the Original siblings returning to the city of [New
Orleans](/wiki/New_Orleans "New Orleans") for the first time since 1919, where
a pregnant Hayley has also settled. Having originally built the city, they had
been forced to abandon it when fleeing from their vengeful father. In their
absence, Klaus's protégé, Marcel ([Charles Michael
Davis](/wiki/Charles_Michael_Davis "Charles Michael Davis")), took charge of
the city. Klaus resolves that they must take down Marcel and get back the city
that once belonged to them. While doing that they must also protect their city
from a war brewing between vampires, werewolves, and witches. Over time, new
and old friendships are formed, love is in the air, death surrounds them, and
the Originals learn more about their own family past. The first season
describes how Klaus's mystical child is going to be born and speaks of the
threats that the Originals together must keep her safe from. The second season
deals with the return of Klaus and his siblings' parents, and the arrival of
an aunt who threatens the baby's life. The third season shows the Mikaelsons
facing both a prophecy that speaks of their downfall, and the first-sired
vampires who have wanted revenge for a millennium. The fourth season jumps
ahead five years, with the Mikaelsons returning to New Orleans and having to
face a reawakened ancient menace set on destroying anything in its path. The
fifth and final season of the series takes place seven years after the fourth
season, with Hope now being a teenager at a school for supernatural children,
the Salvatore Boarding School for the Young and Gifted.

## Cast and
characters[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Cast and characters")]

Main article: [List of The Originals
characters](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters "List of The Originals
characters")

  * [Joseph Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan \(actor\)") as [Niklaus "Klaus" Mikaelson](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Klaus_Mikaelson "List of The Originals characters"): The self-proclaimed King of New Orleans and the Original Hybrid: half-Original Vampire and half-werewolf. As the son of a witch and a werewolf plus being a vampire by magic, Klaus is one of the most ruthless and feared supernatural beings in history but also has a soft spot for his family. He is the father of Hayley's daughter, Hope, and is the adoptive father of Marcel, also his former protégé. He eventually develops feelings for Cami.
  * [Daniel Gillies](/wiki/Daniel_Gillies "Daniel Gillies") as [Elijah Mikaelson](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Elijah_Mikaelson "List of The Originals characters"): An Original Vampire and Klaus's older maternal half-brother. He is shown to be extremely suave, always sporting a suit, and relatively level-headed compared to Klaus's more heated tendencies. He harbors romantic affections for Hayley.
  * [Claire Holt](/wiki/Claire_Holt "Claire Holt") as [Rebekah Mikaelson](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Rebekah_Mikaelson "List of The Originals characters") (main season 1; special guest star season 2–5): An Original Vampire and Klaus's younger maternal half-sister. She is Klaus's favorite and the youngest of the Mikaelson siblings after the death of Henrik. At one time, she was in a romantic relationship with Marcel. Despite her unwavering love for her family, she desires to find love and start a family of her own, which is complicated by her family name and vampire status. She eventually leaves New Orleans to pursue a simpler life outside of her family. Holt departs the main cast near the end of season 1, but has guest starred sporadically in every season since. [Maisie Richardson-Sellers](/wiki/Maisie_Richardson-Sellers "Maisie Richardson-Sellers") portrayed Rebekah during the second half of season 2 and one episode of season 3, when Rebekah possessed witch Eva Sinclair's body.
  * [Phoebe Tonkin](/wiki/Phoebe_Tonkin "Phoebe Tonkin") as [Hayley Marshall](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Hayley_Marshall "List of The Originals characters"): Originally a werewolf, later hybrid, who conceived a daughter with Klaus named Hope. She is revealed to be the long-lost Alpha of her werewolf bloodline. Later, she rises to become the Alpha of the entire Crescent pack when the Alphas of all the other bloodlines bow down before her. She is initially reluctant to be involved with the Mikaelsons, but is eventually accepted into the family and accepts them in return. She reciprocates Elijah's romantic feelings, but marries Jackson Kenner in order to unite their packs.
  * [Charles Michael Davis](/wiki/Charles_Michael_Davis "Charles Michael Davis") as [Marcel Gerard](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Marcel_Gerald "List of The Originals characters"): A vampire, now enhanced Original Vampire, and former slave. He was turned by Klaus, his adoptive father and former mentor. He has a romantic past with both Rebekah and Cami. His relationship with the Mikaelsons is complicated as a result of his history with them as well as philosophical differences. They are often adversarial as Klaus and Marcel constantly struggle for power over New Orleans. He rescues Davina from being sacrificed and takes her under his wing as his adoptive daughter.
  * [Daniella Pineda](/wiki/Daniella_Pineda "Daniella Pineda") as [Sophie Deveraux](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Sophie_Deveraux "List of The Originals characters") (main season 1): A powerful witch of the French Quarter.
  * [Leah Pipes](/wiki/Leah_Pipes "Leah Pipes") as [Camille O'Connell](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Camille_O'Connell "List of The Originals characters") (main seasons 1–3; special guest star season 4–5[6]): A human therapist for Klaus whom he is later affectionate toward, though she was briefly romantically involved with Marcel.
  * [Danielle Campbell](/wiki/Danielle_Campbell "Danielle Campbell") as [Davina Claire](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Davina_Claire "List of The Originals characters") (main seasons 1–3; special guest star season 4–5[7]): A powerful young witch and Marcel's adoptive daughter who becomes Regent of all witch covens in New Orleans. She doesn't much care for the Mikaelsons and seeks to destroy them with Marcel's help, until she unknowingly falls in love with one.
  * [Yusuf Gatewood](/wiki/Yusuf_Gatewood "Yusuf Gatewood") as [Vincent Griffith](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Vincent_Griffith "List of The Originals characters") (guest star season 1; main season 2–5): A witch once possessed by Finn, the eldest brother among the Mikaelson siblings. He is the ex-husband of Eva Sinclair, the witch Rebekah possessed. He succeeds Davina as Regent of all witch covens in New Orleans.
  * [Riley Voelkel](/wiki/Riley_Voelkel "Riley Voelkel") as [Freya Mikaelson](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Freya_Mikaelson "List of The Originals characters") (recurring season 2; main season 3–5): Klaus's long-lost maternal older half-sister, Freya is an immensely powerful and skilled thousand-year-old witch, former immortal, and the eldest of the Mikaelson siblings.
  * [Danielle Rose Russell](/wiki/Danielle_Rose_Russell "Danielle Rose Russell") as [Hope Mikaelson](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Hope_Mikaelson "List of The Originals characters") (main season 5), the teen-aged daughter of Klaus and Hayley, and who is an extremely powerful supernatural being as she holds the three-fold lineage of vampire, werewolf, and witch.
  * [Steven Krueger](/wiki/Steven_Krueger "Steven Krueger") as [Joshua "Josh" Rosza](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_characters#Josh_Rosza "List of The Originals characters") (recurring seasons 1–4; main season 5), a visitor to New Orleans who is soon turned into a vampire. He befriends Davina, and later serves as Marcel's lieutenant.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Production")]

On January 11, 2013, it was announced that a [backdoor
pilot](/wiki/Backdoor_pilot "Backdoor pilot") focused on [the
Originals](/wiki/Original_Vampires_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "Original Vampires
\(The Vampire Diaries\)"), starring [Joseph
Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan \(actor\)") as Klaus and
titled _The Originals_ would air sometime in April for a potential series
pick-up for the 2013–2014 season. On April 26, 2013, _The Originals_ was
confirmed for a full series.[8] This second spin-off attempt will be overseen
by [Julie Plec](/wiki/Julie_Plec "Julie Plec"), with no involvement by Kevin
Williamson.[9] _The Originals_ was officially picked up by The CW on April 26,
2013, for the 2013–14 season.[10] Season one of _The Originals_ was set to
premiere on Tuesday, October 15.[11] However, on July 29, 2013, [The
CW](/wiki/The_CW "The CW") announced that the series premiere would instead
air on October 3, 2013, following the fifth-season premiere of _The Vampire
Diaries_ in order to attract fans of the series.[1] On October 10, 2013, the
CW ordered three additional scripts for the series.[12] On November 11, 2013,
the CW decided to order a full season for _The Originals_.[13]

Following her March 11 episode Claire Holt left the main cast.[14] Holt
confirmed that she will be returning to the show, but she needs to spend time
with her family first.[15]

## _The Originals: The
Awakening_[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: The Originals: The Awakening")]

See also: [List of The Originals episodes § The Originals: The
Awakening](/wiki/List_of_The_Originals_episodes#The_Originals:_The_Awakening
"List of The Originals episodes")

_The Originals: The Awakening_ is a [webseries](/wiki/Webseries "Webseries").
The series explores the character Kol Mikaelson and his relationships with his
siblings. Flashing back to 1914, Kol is on a quest to form an alliance with
the witches of the French Quarter. Awakening gives answers to some questions
about Kol's past, including the origins of his rivalry with his family and the
unique backstory he has with the New Orleans witches. Each webisode is
approximately two minutes long.

##
Novels[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Novels")]

On January 27, 2015, the first book in a series of novels based on the show
was released.[39] _The Rise_ , _The Loss_ , and _The Resurrection_ make up the
three novels in The Originals series written by Julie Plec.[40]

## Spin-
off[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Originals_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Spin-off")]

Main article: [Legacies (TV series)](/wiki/Legacies_\(TV_series\) "Legacies
\(TV series\)")

In August 2017, it was announced that a spin-off focusing on Hope Mikaelson,
the daughter of Klaus and Hayley, was in development. Julie Plec, co-creator
of _The Vampire Diaries_ and creator of _The Originals_ , wrote the script and
is credited with creating the series.[41] In January 2018, it was revealed
that filming for the pilot would go into production in the second quarter of
2018.[42] It was announced in March 2018 that the spin-off was in fact ordered
to pilot, but instead of a traditional pilot, Plec would be delivering a
fifteen-minute pilot presentation of the series to [The CW](/wiki/The_CW "The
CW"). It was also announced that _The Vampire Diaries_ veteran [Matt
Davis](/wiki/Matthew_Davis "Matthew Davis") would star in the project along
with Aria Shahghasemi, Quincy Fouse, Jenny Boyd, and Kaylee Bryant.
Shahghasemi will debut in the fifth season of _The Originals_ as Hope's friend
Landon.[43]

On May 11, 2018, it was announced that the spin-off, titled
_[Legacies](/wiki/Legacies_\(TV_series\) "Legacies \(TV series\)")_ , was
ordered to series for the 2018–19 season. The show will center around "a
17-year-old Hope, along with Alaric's twin daughters, and other young witches,
vampires, and werewolves" as they come of age at the Salvatore Boarding School
for the Young and Gifted.[44]
